quote: I’ve always liked you, from the first moment I saw you at the Pigafetta Stadium.” He kept his distance because he wanted her too much. “And ever since that day, I knew that you were in love with another guy, and that he would sooner or later feel the same way I did.” Cutting ties with her was excruciatingly painful. “I just hoped that he would be stupid enough to let me have you,” he gasped. “But he wasn’t.
author: Mirella Muffarotto, Soccer Sweetheart
category: destiny, epic-love, fate, high-school, love, love-hurts, love-triangle, marika-and-federico, romance, soulmates, star-crossed-lovers, teenage-love, teens, true-love, unconditional-love, young-adult, young-love

quote: Everything created has a beginning, Destiny of the Endless...as everything created has an end.
author: Neil Gaiman, Season of Mists
category: beginning, creation, destiny, ending, grey-ladies, sandman

quote: I won't deny that I haven't been this vulnerable for a long time, it scares me ~ all of it, love, emotion and connection but I've reached a point in my life that I now know this type of love doesn't knock often and when it does, maybe it's time to open the door.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, fate, love, love-and-harmony, love-life, love-quotes, love-quotes-and-sayings, open-your-heart, soul-mates, true-love, twin-flame-love, twin-flames

quote: The universe whispered it's him, but I sent you away ~ I tested our connection and left it to fate, Years have passed and others have come into our lives, but here we are again, meeting another time.Our timing is off, so we set our connection free once again, trusting the winds of fate and the synchronicity it sends.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: connection, connection-with-people, dated-love, destiny, fate, fate-destiny, hope, life, love, love-story, soul-mate, soul-mate-quotes, speacial-one, the-one, true-love

quote: With God, a mountain is only a road waiting to happen.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough, Flecks of Gold on a Path of Stone: Simple Truths for Profound Living
category: anticipating, anticipation, barriers, calling, challenges, destiny, future, god, hope, hopeless, hopelessness, journey, mountains, obstacles, promise, road, victory

quote: How few human beings, the major thought with a sigh, can exert by hard work, thrift, intelligence or any other virtue the slightest influence on their own destiny.
author: FARRELL J.G.

quote: We have a thousand possible, but only one is the target. (Nous avons mille possibles, - Mais un seul est la cible)
author: Charles de Leusse
category: cible, destin, destiny, forecast, one, possible, prévision, target, un

quote: Be the author of your destiny.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Don’t make any plans, because there is only one plan which really works and that is not even devised by you
author: Alok Jagawat

quote: It is ultimately your choices that decide your destiny.
author: Theodore Volgoff, The Mirror of Destiny

quote: Dream is a destiny.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: My path was predetermined by God.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita
category: destiny, faith, god, journey, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, path

quote: Destiny is the point where your circumstances and your actions coincide.
author: Theodore Volgoff, The Mirror of Destiny

quote: Tram’s road is predetermined, but not yours! You are not a tram, you can choose your path
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: destiny, destiny-quote, destiny-quotes, fate, murat-ildan-quotations, path, paths, predetermined, predeterminism, tram, tram-quotes, turkish-writers-quotes

quote: If you have a big destiny, you're going to have to meet and face some big demons. But the good news is that your strength and power is big enough to conquer them all. You are strong enough to overcome all obstacles in your way and to fulfill your Destiny.
author: Jeanette Coron

quote: The human situation, in general or in particular, is slightly worse (ignoring an occasional hiccup in the graph) at any given moment than at any preceding moment.
author: FARRELL J.G.

quote: Your decisions will determine your destination. “No decision” is the decision to be just how you were at where you had been.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, You Can Rise
category: decide, decision, destination, destiny, determination, determine, food-for-thought, forward, go-ahead, improve, improvement, israelmore-ayivor, make-good-decisions, move-forward, personal-development, progress, progressive, self-leadership, you-can-rise

quote: You life matters. You are here for a reason. Your job is to determine why.
author: Michael Hyatt, Living Forward: A Proven Plan to Stop Drifting and Get the Life You Want

quote: Three things in life you will never have to chase: True friends, true love and your destiny!
author: Alex Haditaghi, Softly, As I Leave Her
category: destiny, destiny-and-attitude, destiny-quotes, friends, friendship, friendship-and-love, friendship-quotes, friendship-true-and-loyal, love, love-at-first-sight, love-hurts, love-quotes, lovers

quote: The life of an adoptee is like an ancient voyager who searches for the unknown. The stars guided their destiny. They had their sights on the wonders that lay ahead of them. An adoptee travels in the opposite direction.
author: Diamond Mike Watson, Adopted Like Me: Chosen to Search for Truth, Identity, and a Birthmother

quote: I can see that you go through life athwart it. You see the flow of events, you are able to tell how you could most easily fit yourself into it. But you dare to oppose it. And why? Simply because you look at it and say, 'this fate does not suit me. I will not allow it to befall me.'" Amber shook her head, but her small smile made it an affirmation. "I have always admired people who can do that. So few do. Many, of course, will rant and rave against the garment fate has woven for them, but they pick it up and on it all the same, and most wear it to the end of their days. You... you would rather go naked into the storm.
author: Robin Hobb, Ship of Magic

quote: What separates the wise from the unwise is
author: how a person reacts and responds to each new twist of fate.

quote: But that is what islands are for
author: they are places where different destinies can meet and intersect in the full isolation of time.
category: Lawrence Durrell, Bitter Lemons of Cyprus

quote: The more you recover your authentic self, the more your destiny will unfold before your eyes. Just keep doing your inner work - that's the most essential thing.
author: Robin S. Sharma

quote: When you give up, you are giving others control of your destiny.When you choose not to give up, you take control of your destiny.
author: Alex Haditaghi, Softly, As I Leave Her
category: destiny, destiny-and-attitude, destiny-quotes, life, life-changing, life-lessons, life-philosophy, life-quotes, perseverance, perseverance-quotes, persevere

quote: I saw only the reality of his destiny, which he had knownhow to follow with unfaltering footsteps, that life begun in humblesurroundings, rich in generous enthusiasms, in friendship, love, war--inall the exalted elements of romance.
author: Joseph Conrad, Lord Jim
category: ambition, benevolent, butterflies, destiny, fall, futility, glory, greatness, hope, humility, love, old-man-s-glory, old-wise, pride, raison-d-être, reason-to-live, romance, stein

quote: Our fates are locked together. It would be foolish of me to anger God by leaving you.
author: Mark Tompkins
category: destiny, fate, kismet, last-days-of-magic, mythology, najia, theology

quote: It was not a coincidence. It was not deja vu. It was destiny. It was my destiny to meet her.
author: P. Wish, The Doppelgänger
category: coincidence, dejavu, destiny, double, karma, love

quote: In life also, everything seems to be going great, we take the people who love us, for granted, just like the overlooked trees providing pleasant shade to us during the journey. And then the destiny strikes. Everything falls apart. We want nothing but the sight of those same people whom we had ignored. No one is around then as we leave them far behind during our pursuit of success.
author: Yogesh Datta D., The Garden of Orchids

quote: My position at the Palace is our one opportunity. Have confidence in my destiny. Do not weep.
author: Shan Sa, Empress
category: ancient-china, chinese-female-authors, chinese-women, destiny, faith, girls, opportunity

quote: Destiny is desire meeting opportunity. You become who you are driven to be.
author: Chloe Thurlow, A Girl's Adventure

quote: And then there's the other thing.The thing I'm trying to ignore. The thing I shouldn't want, the thing I can't have.And he's standing in front of me right now.So what do I wish for? Something I'm not sure I want? Someone I'm not sure I need? Or someone I know I can't have?Screw it. Let the fates d
author: Stephanie Perkins, Anna and the French Kiss

quote: Your destiny is the result of the choices that you make, which paths you take in life.
author: Steven Redhead, Unleash The Power of Your Heart and Mind

quote: My train was late that day. the day I saw you drop your notebook. Had it been on schedule we never would have met. Maybe we were never meant to.
author: Erin Morgenstern, The Night Circus

quote: Most people think that love doesn’t stand the test of time – that it is eternal only as long as it lasts – but love is an unquenchable flame. It is only the fires of momentary desire that burn too fast and go out far too quickly without leaving behind a single trace.
author: Mirella Muffarotto, Soccer Sweetheart
category: coming-of-age-love-story, destiny, epic-love, fate, love, love-and-romance, love-hurts, love-stories, soulmates, star-crossed-lovers, teen-romance, teenage-love, true-love, ya-fiction, young-adult, young-adult-contemporary, young-adult-fiction, young-adult-novels, young-adult-romance, young-adult-series, young-love

quote: She'd thought there was no greater connection than destiny decreeing them joined. But there was - the choice they'd made to love each other.
author: Kresley Cole, Sweet Ruin
category: destiny, fate, fated-love, love, romance, true-love, true-love-in-time

quote: That part of your life is over. Set it aside as something you have finished. Complete or no, it is done with you. No being gets to decide what his life is "supposed to be"...'Be a man. Discover where you are now, and go on from there, making the best of things. Accept your life, and you might survive it. If you hold back from it, insisting this is not your life, not where you are meant to be, life will pass you by. You may not die from such foolishness, but you might as well be dead for all the good your life will do you or anyone else.
author: Robin Hobb, The Mad Ship
category: accept, aside, be, complete, dead, decide, destiny, discover, done, end, fate, finish, forget, forgo, future, good, honesty, life, meant, not, over, part, past, path, present, section, set, survive, to, truth

quote: This unrequited love business was driving him crazy. It was a feeling that took you over, mind, body, and soul. Worse than a drug that tore apart your flesh and spirit, and without which you simply could not live.
author: Mirella Muffarotto, Soccer Sweetheart
category: coming-of-age-love-story, destiny, epic-love, fate, love, love-and-romance, love-hurts, love-stories, soulmates, star-crossed-lovers, teen-romance, teenage-love, true-love, ya-fiction, young-adult, young-adult-contemporary, young-adult-fiction, young-adult-novels, young-adult-romance, young-adult-series, young-love

quote: In the quantum multiverse, every choice, every decision you've ever and never made exists in an unimaginably vast ensemble of parallel universes.
author: Nick Payne
category: accountability, choice, destiny, existentialism, fate, sliding-glass-doors

quote: But how can I let him just walk away with a smile on my face and a slap on his back when every cell in my body is tied painfully to him, and I can’t breathe when I think of him being away from me?!
author: Mirella Muffarotto, Soccer Sweetheart
category: destiny, epic-love, fate, love, love-hurts, soulmates, star-crossed-lovers, true-love, ya-fiction, young-adult, young-adult-romance

quote: Hidden inside every flower are seeds of imagination, destiny and future dreams.
author: Sondra Faye

quote: If fate doesn't make you laugh, then you just don't get the joke.
author: Gregory David Roberts, Shantaram

quote: I, the ordinary restless child, the plain adolescent, the commoner who had been a nun twice, would prove to be a Daughter of Heaven.
author: Shan Sa

quote: Seeing him again had been a gut punch.
author: Tan Redding, A Banquet Of Crumbs
category: contemporary, darkness, destiny, fate, loss, love, lovers, romance, sin

quote: I believe in black holes. I believe that as the universe empties into nothingness, past and future will smack together in the last swirl around the drain. I believe this is how Thomas Stone materialized in my life. If that's not the explanation, then I must invoke a disinterested God who leaves us to our own devices, neither causing nor preventing tornadoes or pestilence, but a God who will now and then stick his thumb on the spinning wheel so that a father who put a continent between himself and his sons should find himself in the same room as one of them.
author: Abraham Verghese, Cutting for Stone

quote: We go through life and don't pay attention to God even when he's yelling. Then there are the moments you never expect and can't avoid. It is at those times when you can hear him ever so clearly
author: even when he's whispering.

quote: If you fatally kill fate,your life sentence will beto steer the reins of choice.
author: Khang Kijarro Nguyen

quote: You want me to paint you?’ Genna spoke up raising an eyebrow of displeasure.‘All of me.’ James bowed his head to Genevieve and whispered the words slowly.
author: Tan Redding, A Banquet Of Crumbs
category: contemporary-romance, darkness, destiny, forgiveness, hurt, loss, love, lovers, sin

quote: A trusted man doesn't flip-flop on where he stands. He says what he means and stand where he stands.He's not easily influenced by fear. He's influenced by destiny and will not be taken advantage of.
author: Henry Johnson Jr
category: destiny, henry-johnson-jr, honesty, influence-inspiration, liberia, love, trust, truth-telling

quote: Stop saying hurt.’ She turned on him; the wounded animal finally breaking free. ‘You fall over on the pavement, that hurts; you stub your toe, that hurts; you trap your finger in a car door, shit, that hurts. You did not hurt me. James. It was like you took a razor and pressed down hard in the tenderest place.
author: Tan Redding, A Banquet Of Crumbs
category: contemporary, darkness, desire, destiny, deviant, fate, forgiveness, loss, love, lovers, romance, sadness, sin

quote: Our thoughts define our destiny.
author: Debasish Mridha
category: debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, destiny, inspirational, philosophy, quotes, thoughts, thoughts-define-our-destiny

quote: From experience, I can tell you that if you go around trying to figure out what's fair in life or whether you deserve something or not, that's a rabbit hole that is hard to climb out of.
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid, Maybe in Another Life

quote: Destiny sees things as they are, not as we would wish them to be. He knows there are no stories, only the illusion of stories: threads and patterns that seem to appear in the pages of existence given meaning and significance by the observer. Destiny observes worlds and molecules like motes of dust hanging in a sunbeam: every movement, every moment inevitable. Destiny walks the paths of his garden, a place of forks and paths which combine and part, seeing only what is. He is surprised by nothing. There is nothing that can surprise him, nothing that was not already written in his book.
author: Neil Gaiman, The Sandman: Overture

quote: Everyone has a destiny. Rosie told me that. A future that already exists – hidden from us but still there, in the future – and each thing that happens to us, each choice we make, each person in our life takes us closer to it.
author: Debbie Howells, The Bones of You

quote: Race and class were a kind of destiny
author: very little could dent them. Morgan himself had been decanted back into the vessel that had made him.

quote: For each of us, there comes a time when we must awaken and become what we were born to become.
author: Seth Adam Smith, Rip Van Winkle and the Pumpkin Lantern
category: awakening, becoming, destiny, feathertop, great-awakening, growth, growth-process, rebirth

quote: There but for the... good choices I've made, genetics, psychological conditioning, and 10K random elements, go I.
author: Daniel Ionson

quote: Public opinion only affects those who do not know their destiny.
author: Daryl Baugh

quote: I have known many who led their fighters to titles, and some who took them right to the end of the rainbow. I have found, however, that destiny controls the passes to these places, and I keep telling myself, trying to believe it, that it is not important, really, how far you go but how you make the trip.
author: W.C. Heinz

quote: Is it not beautiful to discover a new path to your destiny and decorate it with the beauty of your imagination?
author: Debasish Mridha
category: beauty-of-your-imagination, debasish-mridha, debasish-mridha-m-d, destiny, discover-a-new-path, imagination, inspirational, philosophy, quotes

quote: It's still strange.
author: Arthur K. Flam
category: bizarre, destiny, fate, interview, life, nihilism, strange, writing

quote: Destiny has got the rope round my neck – and I feel it.
author: Wilkie Collins

quote: I think sometimes, despite our good intentions and wise choices, something's are up to fate and we learn to play our part the best we can.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: beautiful, chaos, destiny, destiny-quotes, fate, growth, insight, intentions, let-go, life, mindful, nikki-rowe, quote-of-the-day, quotes-about-life, quotes-for-the-soul, quotes-to-live-by, trust, wisdom, wise, wise-words

quote: The greater the destiny, the greater obstacles you’ll have to overcome. No great destiny comes without great challenges and sacrifices.
author: Jeanette Coron
category: challenges, destiny, great-destiny, overcoming-obstacles, sacrifices, success

quote: Do you want to give a special gift in the New Year to someone you love? Then let him or her realize this: We are the main shepherd of our fate, we are the main designer of our destiny!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: designer, destiny, destiny-quotes, fate, fate-quotes, ildan-wise-sayings, new-year, new-year-quotations, new-year-quotes, shepherd

quote: I’ve had enough of this destiny bullshit, OK?
author: Giselle Simlett, Girl of Myth and Legend

quote: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.
author: ― Albert Ellis

quote: Kolya was a braggart, a know-it-all, a Jew-baiting Cossack, but his confidence was so pure and complete it no longer seemed like arrogance, just the mark of a man who had accepted his own heroic destiny.
author: David Benioff, City of Thieves

quote: It’s better to die pursuing your dreams and destiny, than to live a life in fear of failure.
author: Jeanette Coron

quote: I dead each day when her call was busy elsewhere.
author: Atul Purohit, Love Vs Destiny . . .the strange game of life!
category: busy, confidential, death-and-love, destiny, faith, love, lust, revenge, trust

quote: Life is a daring sacred existence.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: daring, destiny, fate, inspiration, life, mission, purpose-driven-life, sacred, self-acceptance, self-esteem, self-love, spirituality

quote: Let each person decide his or her fate.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: attitude, choices, decision, destiny, fate, inspirational, uniqueness

quote: One's freedom is one's love and one's love is one's undoing, it's all in the dictionary...
author: Duncan McNaughton, Valparaiso
category: california-poets, destiny, dictionaries, dictionary, fate, freedom, love, metaphysical-dilemmas, philosophy-of-life, poetic-perspective, san-francisco-poets

quote: Because this, as it turned out, was her destiny. Not to be the powerful sorceress her people had been waiting for , not to to be the ruthless killer the assassins needed. Her destiny was to save one person at a time, change things one tiny step after another.It still hurt, a tinge of loss. Her life wouldn't be grand, or dramatic, or momentous. There would be no great choices to make, no moments when everything would change. It would make a dull story if she was ever called upon to tell it.It hurt, yes. But it was also something of a relief.
author: Leah Cypess

quote: The brevity of life is the grace to walk on your own path.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: adventure, belief, bravery, christian-life, daring, destiny, determined-spirit, divine, fate, fearless, grace-and-favor, grace-of-god, journey, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, lessons-learnt, life, motivation, path, perseverance, spiritual, walking

quote: When your destiny is calling, answer The call.
author: Jeanette Coron

quote: If tragedy never entered our lives, we wouldn't appreciate the magic.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, fate, grateful, healer, inspiration, lightworkers, magic, seek, serendipity, spiritual, tragedy

quote: It isn't where you're born in this world, it's what you do.
author: Winston Graham, Jeremy Poldark

quote: Give your all to every experience, feel it breathe it appreciate it, nothing lasts forever, when it's gone you'll remember the feeling it once gave you and sometimes that's enough.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, experience, fate, fate-quotes, grateful, growth, healer, inner-being, journey, journey-quotes, let-go, life-lessons, life-quotes, lightworkers, love, move-forward-quotes, moving-on-quotes, purpose, serendipity, women-quotes

quote: It is destiny which takes you to people who have the answers to your questions.
author: Aporva Kala, Alchemist of the East

quote: Names aren't loners, they're connected, even in real life. You name your kids for someone dead or what you hope they will become or what you wish you were and your parents did the same to you and that big, glittering net of names tells the story of the whole world. Names are load-bearing struts. Names are destiny.
author: Catherynne M. Valente, Radiance

quote: The moment you think that your destiny is predetermined, you become a miserable loser! Trust your own power so that you can shape your own destiny!
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
category: destiny, destiny-quotes, ildan-words-of-wisdom, loser, loser-quotes, losers, miserable, moment, predetermined, trust

quote: Men who’ve made choices always feel they own their destiny. Few ever think to ask who shaped and offered up those choices. Who dangles the carrot they think they’ve chosen to follow.
author: Mark  Lawrence, Prince of Fools

quote: Your secret sin vs your destiny you decide which one wins.
author: Joe Joe Dawson

quote: Be master of your destiny.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: christian-life, destiny, faith, hope, inspirational, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, life, self-esteem, wise-words

quote: You have a great light to illuminate the world.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: darkness, destiny, humanity, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, light, mission, motivation, purpose, servie, shine-your-light, uplifting, your-fate

quote: ​The destiny of nations depends upon the manner in which they feed themselves.
author: Anthelme Brillat-Savarin
category: destiny, feed, food, manner, nations, thought-provoking

quote: To be myself, to follow my desires to the best of my abilities. That’s the only end worth shooting for. Success and failure lie beyond us, they may be signposts that direct us, but they are foolish goals in themselves. To truly be who I have been made to be, made myself to be, ah, that is the only mission worthy of all the life that flows within.
author: James Rozoff, Seven Stones
category: ambition, desire, destiny, fate, goals, life

quote: You ought to thirst for the living water.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: destiny, faith, fate, god, hope, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, mission, self-discovery, spirituality, water

quote: Almighty God guide us to the right destination.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: adversity, crossroad, destiny, god, journey, lailah-gifty-akita, life, mission, motivational, travel, wise-words

quote: . . . what I told Malory happened next is that when he looked over at her then it was like he'd been waiting a hundred years to see her, and this crazy ass Ledfeather girl all the way from Standing Rock, she looked off after the elk and then back at Doby through her hair, like she'd maybe been waiting for him too, but was scared a little, wanted to be sure, so Doby opened his mouth and said her name across the backseat of Junior's cab, Claire, like a flower opening in his mouth, and she held her lips together and nodded thank you to him, yes, thank you, and then swallowed what was in her throat and just let the sides of their hands touch together again some like it didn't really matter.But it did.
author: Stephen Graham Jones, Ledfeather
category: destiny, hope, love, native-american-literature, soulmates, time-travel, twist

quote: I asked the universe for serendipity and you walked through my door.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, fate, love, love-quotes, magic, quote-of-the-day, quotes, serendipity, synchronicity, true-love, word-porn

quote: She wasn't kind of lady that depended on a man and I think that's what made her so irrestible to them, any man she had loved she wanted ~ and the men that loved her back couldn't handle not being needed, so she showed them the door and grew her own wings as they walked out. Love to her isn't a maybe thing, nor is it attachment and any man whom thinks he will ever own her would be best not to try at all.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: beautiful, destiny, empowerment, free-spirited, independent-women, love, true-love, untameable, wild-and-free, wild-heart, women-quotes, women-s-strength

quote: Sometimes fate just plays a strange scrabble.
author: Pawan Mishra, Coinman: An Untold Conspiracy
category: destiny, fate, life, scrabble, strange, wisdom, wise

quote: The consequence model, the logical one, the amoral one, the one which refuses any divine intervention, is a problem really for just the (hypothetical) logician. You see, towards God I would rather be grateful for Heaven (which I do not deserve) than angry about Hell (which I do deserve). By this the logician within must choose either atheism or theism, but he cannot possibly through good reason choose anti-theism. For his friend in this case is not at all mathematical law: the law in that 'this equation, this path will consequently direct me to a specific point'; over the alternative and the one he denies, 'God will send me wherever and do it strictly for his own sovereign amusement.' The consequence model, the former, seeks the absence of God, which orders he cannot save one from one's inevitable consequences; hence the angry anti-theist within, 'the logical one', the one who wants to be master of his own fate, can only contradict himself - I do not think it wise to be angry at math.
author: Criss Jami, Healology
category: amoral, amusement, anger, angry, anti-theism, apologetics, arrogance, atheism, bible, choice, conclusion, consequence, contradiction, damnation, decision, destiny, divine-intervention, ego, equation, eternity, faith, fate, force, god, grace, gravity, heaven, hell, honesty, humility, hypocrisy, hypothetical, illogical, intervention, logic, logical, logician, love, master, math, mathematics, mercy, model, perspective, pride, punishment, rational, reason, religion, religion-and-science, ruler, salvation, science, sovereignty, sovereignty-of-god, thankfulness, theism, truth

quote: Then I defy you, stars!
author: William Shakespeare, Romeo and Juliet

quote: Love of God and people will pave roads where there once were none.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: blessings, colleagues, connections, destiny, direction, divine-intervention, fate, friends, god, networking, no-coincidences, open-doors, opportunities, opportunity-knocks, unexpected-friendships

quote: Destiny is usually around the corner. Like a thief, like a hooker, or a lottery vendor: its three most common personifications. But what destiny does not do is home visits. You have to go for it
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafón, The Shadow of the Wind

quote: If you don’t’ know what you want, others will give you what they want.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: choices, decisions, desires, destiny, educational-philosophy, inspirational, know, mission, purpose, want, wisdom-of-winners, wise-words, wishes, your-life

quote: The living word of God is the light for my path.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: calling-people, christian-life, destiny, god, guidance, journey, lailah-gifty-akita-affirmations, life, light, mission, path, shining-your-light, spiritual, stars, travel, word-of-god

quote: If you think about it for a moment, destiny is not a synonym of circumstance.
author: Unarine Ramaru
category: circumstances, destiny, fate, lifestyle, positivity, pursuit-of-happiness

quote: I am created to know, love, and served my Creator.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: creation, destiny, divine-self, fate, god, life, religion, spiritualiy, wisdom-of-lailah-gifty-akita

quote: One wonderful lesson I’ve learnt is that the life will never become perfect whatever you may do. As we have always been told, nothing is perfect anyway. But I wonder, if it did, then there will be no more need to live further. Having mastered all the lessons of the fifth class, why be in it any more? So, this life is actually not planned to satisfy and it does not satisfy. If it did, then there will be no progress and nothing more to live for. Life is planned to allure first and dissatisfy at last. Allure, so that we may enter into with zest and hope; and dissatisfy, so that we may not like to settle in it forever, but seek other higher forms of life. So, troubles keep us from falling, they keep us from being blown away, they are counter weights in life to keep balance.Troubles are like soap and water, without you don’t keep pure and fresh. The baby dislikes soap and water-bath, resists and kicks, and so we do with troubles. Like a tonic, they provoke thoughts, provoke actions and promote further growth. So, life in a way teaches us that the will of destiny is not that we should be free from troubles and sorrows, but be clean, fresh, active and ever growing.
author: Manasa Rao

quote: Years have passed, I suppose. I'm not really counting them anymore. I don't know where or when. Who does? Where are all the rains of yesterday?In the invisible city?Inside me?It is cold and quiet outside and the horizon is infinity. There is no sense of movement.There is no moon, and the stars are very bright, like broken diamonds, all.

quote: Looking down from the heavens, she saw how small, and yet how important each human life is. Drops in the bucket of eternity. She saw her minute place in the organic machine of the Cosmos, witnessed the give and take and the slow, steady swinging of life's pendulum. The world relies on order, pattern, and repetition. The earth spins and swings around the sun with rational, mathematical predictability. But she also saw the chaotic nature of things. No matter what, you can never know with certainty what will happen. Lightening can strike, the ground can open up and swallow you, and the very air you breathe can tear your life away.
author: Gwen Mitchell, Rain of Ash
category: chaos, destiny, karma, life, meaning-of-life, order, universe

quote: If it doesn't look like success, it isn't your true destiny on earth.

Kill him? Would that be it? No man knew better than he the tricks that Destiny plays on a man, or how often the right man dies at the wrong time and place. A man never wore a gun without inviting trouble, he never stepped into a street and began the gunman's walk without the full knowledge that he might be a shade too slow, that some small thing might disturb him just long enough!

quote: Yesterday, she shed tears, keeping her head on my shoulders. And I think she's not going to be fine because I know she won't. Because a couple of years back, I wasn't.And when you know that you've fallen hard on a cold ground and are still lying there, what do you tell others who are taking the fall?You close your eyes. You accept to lie there a little longer. But I lie on my bed now, and it's a little too warm today.
author: Sanhita Baruah

quote: Everything is destined sometimes we think something and happens opposite to it. This is the fact and the truth we all live with this verity. We are all the tools of God uses us for its own purpose.

quote: People wrote me off but they did not realize that I was a writer - I rewrote my own destiny.

quote: You will get what you wish to have.

quote: I don’t believe in influence. I think that in order to be an artist, you have to move. When you stop moving, then you’re no longer an artist. And if you move from somebody else’s position, you simply cannot know the next step. I think that everyone is on his own line. I think that after you’ve made one step, the next step reveals itself. I believe that you were born on this line. I don’t say that the actual footsteps were marked before you get to them, and I don’t say that change isn’t possible in your course. But I do believe we unfold out of ourselves, and we do what we are born to do sooner or later, anyway.
author: Agnes Martin

quote: I would lose him a thousand lifetimes over if it meant I got the chance to love him a thousand times. And have him love me back.If only for a little while.
author: A.J. Compton, The Counting-Downers
category: destiny, life, loss, love, romance, soulmates

quote: There's just got to be more to life than dresses, shoes, hair-dos, make-ups, selfies, big houses and the latest cars. Every individual must go on a hunt for something deeper, larger, eternal and fulfilling than these transcient things which will either degenerate or rot. There must be a desperate need in her to doggedly pursue her Creator to find that higher calling and divine purpose for which she was born. Otherwise even if she has ten children, she'll leave this earth more barren than she entered it, never really having birthed what all along she never knew she was pregnant with: Desitny.
author: Theresa Pecku-Laryea

quote: The destinies of all followers lie in the hands of their leaders.

quote: What we decide does not mean will always happen, so be content with what you are

quote: It doesn't matter if we don't mean to do the things we do. It doesn't mean if it was an accident or a mistake. It doesn't even matter if we think this is all up to fate. Because regardless of our destiny, we still have to answer for our actions. We make choices, big and small, every day of our lives, and those choices have consequences.
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid, Maybe in Another Life

quote: I believe in the ability to choose. I believe this life is made up of our choices and their consequences— the good and the bad. I do not believe in letting anything up to fate. We are the makers of our own destinies, our own futures, our own paths. To blindly follow is an insult to the miracle of being human. To be human is to make choices; the moment you allow others to make decisions for you is the moment you do an injustice to not only mankind but to yourself.
author: Kelseyleigh Reber, If I Resist
category: being-human, choices, choices-and-consequences, destiny, fate, humanity, inspirational, life-lessons, mankind, miracle-of-life, philosophy-of-life, values-and-beliefs

quote: An obscure character by the name of Belial. He is interpreted as a minion of the devil by some scholars, but that is wrong. It is ignorance. The name means, literally speaking, 'one who cannot be yoked,' and it is really every one of us who takes control of our own destiny while others blow in the wind. We may be punished for it, but we would never do it another way. We are all Belials.
author: Matthew Pearl, The Last Bookaneer

quote: Of all the people in the world who could've won the seat next to mine at that playoff game... it was you, Gemma. You. The one person on the planet who might just understand me.
author: Julie   Johnson, Not You It's Me
category: chase-croft, destiny, fate, gemma-summers, love, soulmates

quote: We do have the ability to manifest things, but our purpose, our end, our legacy is alsocontrolled by our destiny. So focus on what comes easy—that is your destined life.
author: Emma Mildon, The Soul Searcher's Handbook: A Modern Girl's Guide to the New Age World
category: destined, destiny, manifest, purpose, spiritual-quotes, spirituality

quote: There are no accidents, Anna. Everything correlates. Everything connects. Every detail bears a consequence. One instant begets the next. And the next. And the next.
author: Jill Alexander Essbaum, Hausfrau

quote: Good is good and bad is bad, and nowhere is the difference between good and bad so wide and so fateful as in human character. For character makes destiny in the individual and in the race.
author: Edward O. Sisson

quote: Rather blessings, after counting my misfortunes, I realized how the more blessed I am.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: a-time-to-grow, bad-luck, being-strong, blessed, born-into-this, calamity, count, curses, destiny, disaster, fate, gain, god-will-make-a-way, knowledge, lessons-learned, lose, misadventure, misfortune, moving-on, realize, solutions, struggle-for-strength, things-could-be-worse, trial, tribulation, understanding, wisdom

quote: HeDestiny is very jealous FOR TRUE LOVE
author: Arshdeep Singh Samrala

quote: The destiny of your nation is in your hands, waiting for your actions.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: People that live on the edge of two millenniums are people of a special destiny
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Character is like 'Structural Integrity' in the field of engineering.A construction is believed to have structural integrity when it can withstand 'impact' from anywhere and anything, functioning adequately for its desired purposes and service life, until a physical collapse proves otherwise.'Integrity' springs from the original Latin root 'integrum', which means "Intact".A man has INTEGRITY when he remains INTACT, despite the IMPACT of forces that seek to sidetrack him.He will never confuse "what is" with "what ought to be", EVEN WHEN "what is" will work in his favour.A man who will choose, not what the world forces his hands to choose, but what aligns with his destiny and will propel him to become what he is meant to become.Such men are few, such men should be me and you.
author: Olaotan Fawehinmi, The Soldier Within
category: building, character, choice, construction, destiny, engineering, favour, impact, intact, integrity, life, olaotan-fawehinmi, purpose, structural-integrity, structure

quote: Life is not a matter of choices! Life is handed to you, a couple of cards that have cycled through the grimy hands of hundreds of players before you. There are no aces hidden up your sleeve. There is no shortcut to success and happiness. Sleight of hand will only earn you a bloody nose and a thrashing in the alley outback. So instead, you play the few good cards you have and do what you can with the bad, and you play fair. There is no choice.
author: Kelseyleigh Reber, If I Resist
category: adam-laurence, chance, choices, destiny, fate, if-i-resist, life, life-choices, life-lessons, life-philosophy

quote: The destiny of any country is in the hands of her church.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: But at that moment she had known, with a certainty she would never feel about anything else in her life, that it was right, that she wanted this man in her life. Something inside her said, He understands. What it's like to be different.
author: Celeste Ng, Everything I Never Told You

quote: It was all a matter of timing," she says. "My train was late that day. The day I saw you drop your notebook. Had it been on schedule we never would have met. Maybe we were never meant to. It was a possibility, one of thousands, and not inevitable, the way some things are.
author: Erin Morgenstern

quote: What matters most, is not how my end happens, or if it happens now. What I care about in this instant, is that she knows how much I love her—that I lived long enough to have her love me back.
author: Emm Cole, Keeping Merminia
category: against-all-odds, death, destiny, dying, dying-young, fate, fated, happily-ever-after, love-story, soul-mates, true-love, unconditional-love, unrequited-love

quote: I knew that something profound was coming my way and I was just treading water, waiting for it. I didn't know what it was. I didn't know where it was. I didn't know if it was coming next year or next month. But I knew I was different from my friends in where I was going.
author: Diana, Princess of Wales

quote: The effects of Fate come together like stew simmering with provisions from the universe. Which ingredients we’ve used make the end result easy to swallow or bitterly distasteful. So choose wisely for, when our lot in life is done, only those young enough or strong enough can toss their destiny aside and start over.
author: Elizabeth  Good, Trampled Underfoot: The Dirt on Vic and Lia

quote: This was all in the making, a long time ago. You had as much control over these events as a leaf does in the time of its falling.
author: Colin Meloy
category: colinmeloy, destiny, fate, inspirational, leaf, life, pruemckeel, wildwood

quote: The destiny of every country is in the hands of the people who know God.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Life’s journey on earth is the only sacred travel.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Pearls of  Wisdom: Great  mind
category: destiny, fate, journey, journey-to-yourself, life, purpose, sacred, self-help, spiritual-sayings, time-travel, travel, wisdom, your-life

quote: Who's to know what makes a bird wake up and decide to change its song? It was written that our world would change and it changed.
author: Eliot Pattison, The Lord of Death
category: bird-song, changes, destiny, fate, karma, metaphors

quote: Don’t just pray, but reach out in prayer to get an understanding of God’s plan, of His revelation and vision for your life.
author: Pastor Adelaja Sunday

quote: God works on earth only through the prayers of believers and based on this basis, the destiny of this world is not in the hands of earthly kings and rulers but in the hands of prayer warriors.
author: Sunday Adelaja

quote: Obey every rule that will enhance your trust in God for greater work! Break every law that might cause a tear in your relationship with Him against your destiny!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Daily Drive 365
category: break-the-yoke, destiny, greater-work, law, obedience, obey, regulations, relate, relation, relationship, rule, rules, rules-and-regulations, tear, trust-in-god

quote: She said that my good qualities were my bad qualities -- this I have come to realize is true of everyone. On the one hand, I was game, eager and perfectly ready to see what was in front of me. On the other hand, I had no sense of direction or destiny.
author: Laurie Colwin

quote: If you don’t believe your whole life has been a path leading to this one point, you’re not focused enough.” Master Sergeant Gabriel Luther Wells.
author: Mark Henwick, Cool Hand

quote: Saying something is “meant to be” is a cop out. It’s a way for people to deal when they screw up or when life hands them a bowl of shit stew. The things that are meant to be are the things we can’t control, the things we don’t cause, the things that happen regardless of who or what we are. Like sunsets and snow-fall and natural disasters. I’ve never believed hardship or suffering was meant to be. I’ve never believed relationships were meant to be. We choose. In large part, we choose. We create, we make mistakes, we burn bridges, we build new ones.
author: Amy Harmon, The Song of David

quote: You have no control over how your story begins or ends. But by now, you should know that all things have an ending. Every spark returns to darkness. Every sound returns to silence. Every flower returns to sleep with the earth. The journey of the sun and moon is predictable. But yours, is your ultimate art.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: art, beginning-ending, beginnings-and-endings, destiny, dreams, fate, journey, journey-of-life, moon, silence, sun

quote: People meet when they need to meet.
author: Paulo Coelho, Aleph

quote: But you have to take control of your destiny. And sometimes that's not easy.
author: Mari Mancusi, Gamer Girl
category: destiny, gamer-girl, life-lessons, maddy, mari-mancusi, mom, mother-daughter-talk

quote: We have been called by God
author: we must live life worthy of our calling.
category: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: Sarah Jane turned to face me square on, her eyes full of compassion and wisdom and strength I could never match. "You are the gaurdian, Jess. The truth is inside you if you look for it. Trust that you're here because you're destined to be.”She didn't know how crazy her request was. Someone like Sarah Jane could never understand. she was asking me to tear down my defenses, walls that kept me protected in my lobely but safe bubble. A bubble that let me belive I was good enough, that people just hadn't gotten the chance to really know me.I closed my eyes and took a deep breath praying for some kind of sign. No lighntning bolt appeared in the sky, but a momentary shower of peace rained over me. It went and came so quickly I wondered if I had imagined it, but in the end, I knew. if tere was a time to trust , this was it."Trust the universe and go with God," Nan would always say. It scared the living hck out of me. What happns when they realize I'm just me?
author: Kay Cassidy, The Cinderella Society

quote: May you find grace to accomplish your God given-goals.

quote: Think with your eyes open.
author: Shelly Crane

quote: We are always people that are in the making, constantly adapting to accommodate the roads we walk. As we learn, it changes us. As we go about our course, we grow, and prune everything around us; friends, beliefs, desires. Our past experiences plant the seeds needed for our future roads, with all its turns, speed, and treachery.

quote: If all you do is set goals and achieve them then you have learned to be a doer. Happiness isn’t at the end of the next goal. It is the journey of aligning your choices to mold your character into the type of person who lives their belief system, then creates a life purpose that reflects that same person.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: achievement, attitude, consistency, destiny, direction, doers, friendship, goal-setters, goals, happiness, healing, lessons-learned-in-life, life-purpose-101, one-path, one-soul, one-wolf, unity

quote: I think the idea of a soul mate is too romanticised, Don't get me wrong; romance is bliss, but to me, A soul mate is something so much more. It is possibility when hope falls short, it is waking on a Monday excited for breakfast - because it's with them, it's finding the simple pleasures of life so exhilarating - because your side by side, it is experiencing a connection that won't break, alter or dis-courage the growth of both individual journeys, a soul mate isn't just romance, to me it is so much more.
author: Nikki Rowe

quote: Bird has to fly with their own wings; we have to think our own thoughts, find our own destiny.
author: Debasish Mridha

author: Dean Koontz, Odd Interlude: A Special Odd Thomas Adventure
category: annamaria, destiny, life, love, odd-thomas, purpose, understanding

quote: Don't allow others to put a cap on you. Don't simply agree when someone draws your own finishing line. You're the captain of your destiny!!!
author: Assegid Habtewold

quote: Names are powerful and are prophecies of the future. The name you are called is a sign of what you are and what you would become.
author: Jude Idada, Didi Kanu and the Singing Dwarfs of the North
category: african, black, culture, destiny, inspirational, names, nigerian

quote: For everyone has a destiny. A destiny not found in the pages of a hefty book; a destiny not found in heaven or in hell. No, our destinies are embedded in our bodies.
author: Plamen Chetelyazov, Flaws of Oblivion

quote: The love between Uncle Dees and Roger was every bit as enduring as it had been immediate. They were never to be seen apart, man and dog, not since the moment of their introduction. Very quickly after their arrival in Amsterdam four years earlier, Roger had given Alma to understand that he was no longer her dog--that, in fact, he had never been her dog, nor had he ever been Ambrose's dog, but that he had been Dees' dog all along, by force of pure and plain destiny. The fact that Roger was born in distant Tahiti, whereas Dees van Devender resided in Holland, had been the result, Roger appeared to believe, of an unfortunate clerical error, now thankfully rectified.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert, The Signature of All Things

quote: I have been capable of some mischief in the past. I know what rebellion feels like. Everyone and everything is provided with a destiny, but there is no obligation whatsoever to fulfill it. Some just prefer to ignore the humming of their soul.
author: E.A.A. Wilson, Ascension Denied
category: afterlife, angels, death, destiny, fate, soul

quote: Always put the unknown future into the hands of the known God. He has the key it will take to unlock your locked doors.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Daily Drive 365
category: destiny, fervent-prayer, food-for-thought, future, god, intercession, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, lock, pray, pray-hard, pray-to-god, prayer, unlock

quote: What is Divine duty compared to the kiss of a women...what is Destiny compared to the soft touch of a lady....what is the will of a God compared to the eyes and voice of the one you love.
author: Takini

quote: Leadership is inherent in our nature and is fundamental to our origins, our human makeup –and our destiny.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Watchwords
category: born-to-lead, destiny, dominate, food-for-thought, fundamental, human-being, inherent, israelmore-ayivor, lead, leader, leaders, leadership, makeup, myles-munroe, natural, nature, origin, purpose, purposeful

author: Bidemi Mark-Mordi

quote: Stop believing the false hope that "if it’s meant to be” it will happen. If that were true, everyone would be content, wealthy, fit and have great relationships. You must plan, act, persevere, make better choices, know your value and never, ever accept less than you truly deserve. It's not up to chance, it's up to you.
author: Rob Liano
category: action, better-life, chance, choices, destiny, fate, inspiration, inspirational-quotes, luck, meant-to-be, perseverance, responsibility, self-esteem, self-worth, soulmates, soulmates-quote, success, success-quote, value

quote: Many people will never learn the lessons meant for them in this lifetime, nor become the person they were meant to be, simply because they are too busy being someone else.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem

quote: Love is a commitment to cherish another's heart as if it were your own, it is an adventure to seek into all that creates them, it is laying under the stars and dreaming far and wide, it is seeing fear and grabbing each others to face it anyway, it is allowing another to be themselves with out your consent, it is knowing when darkness fills them you don't carry their burden; you just lighten their load. And if your love isn't as beautiful as this, why have you been loving the wrong one for so long?
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, love, love-quotes, quotes-of-the-day, rare-love, real-love, true-love, true-love-quotes

quote: Whatever makes you crazy is what you were created to crack. Whatever makes you sleepless is what you were born to succeed in. Don’t give up!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Watchwords
category: born-to-lead, crack, craze, crazy, create, destiny, don-t-give-up, food-for-thought, israelmore-ayivor, never-give-up, purpose, sleep, sleepless, succeed, success, successful, vision, visionary, your-purpose

quote: Now, as the weeks passed, there was a future, there was a trouble that would not go away.
author: Arthur Miller, A View from the Bridge: A Play in Two Acts

quote: We all want to feel like the most beautiful woman in the room, to be chosen and loved forever. The Cinderella story gives us hope of our impossible dreams becoming true.
author: Beth M Jones
category: beautiful, cinderella, cinderella-story, destiny, dreams, fairy-tales, purpose

quote: Blurred is the picture, To not know what's next! Is it the laughter that awaits, Or sorrows lined up to dictate. Untold, unclear is...A story of our fate!
author: Somya Kedia
category: destiny, fate, laughter, next, picture, sorrows, story, unclear, untold

quote: This is a new land, this is a new place, this is a new world, this is unknown. This is uncharted, this is all there is. We don't have any other place to go. I always quote Gene as saying "Why are we now going into space? Well, why did we trouble to look past the next mountain? Our prime obligation to ourselves is to make the unknown known. We are on a journey to keep an appointment with whatever we are." And that was his whole philosophy of Star Trek, of life, of everything else.
author: Majel Barrett Roddenberry

quote: It is an obvious fact that you can never look ahead with clarity at your own future or anybody else's. You can't know what will happen until it happens. Or maybe it dawns on you the split second before, when you get a glimpse of your own fate.
author: Amanda Lindhout, A House in the Sky

quote: If I have found my journey to be a maddening tangle of wandering ‘rabbit-trails,’ a labyrinth of incessantly circular passages to nowhere and back, and a plethora of assorted ‘dead-ends’ fraudulently disguised as paths of great promise, it can only be because I have mindlessly exchanged God’s compass for mine. Therefore, it would appear that another exchange might be in order.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, compass, destiny, direction, god, journey, path

quote: The wisdom of man can only produce works on a human level. Only the Wisdom of God can realize things divine, and it is to divine heights that it destines us.
author: Father Jacques Philippe
category: destiny, divine, god, heaven, truth, wisdom

quote: Nothing before its time, son. Everything in its own time, to its own schedule.
author: Dean Koontz, Forever Odd
category: chief-wyatt-porter, destiny, fate, odd-thomas, schedule, time

quote: We all want to feel like the most beautiful girl in the room, to be chosen and loved forever. The Cinderella story gives us hope of our impossible dreams becoming true.
author: Beth Moore Jones, The Cinderella Story: The Power of Shoes
category: beautiful, cinderella, cinderella-story, destiny, dreams, purpose

quote: I think there are some who live on a knife-edge in the soul, and at times are driven to hurl themselves into the air, at the mercy of heaven or he'll which way to fall.
author: Ellis Peters, A Morbid Taste for Bones

quote: Remember that sometimes you find your destiny in the places you least expect it.
author: Sarah Holman, The Destiny of One

quote: Nothing in life is a foregone conclusion unless and until it is foregone and concluded
author: Rasheed Ogunlaru
category: anything-is-possible, being-open, changing-your-mind, changing-your-mindset, changing-your-ways, destiny, fate, forego, foregone, fresh-outlook, inspiring-quotes, jumping-to-conclusions, life, life-lessons, mindset, quotes-on-possibility, rasheed-ogunlaru, rasheed-ogunlaru-quotes, serendipity, wisdom

quote: sometimes what you have planned, is nothing like the plan your soul invited you, to this earth for.
author: Nikki Rowe
category: destiny, destiny-quotes, fate, fate-quotes, growth, purpose, soul

quote: I believe that purpose is not only a destination but it is the energy that pushes us toward its fulfillment.
author: Suzette R. Hinton

quote: The good news is that God gave us imaginations because he wanted us to take a tour into our future, see what’s there for us and then we prepare to relocate into it!
author: Israelmore Ayivor
category: destiny, dreams, food-for-thought, future, god, good-news, imagination, imaginations, israelmore-ayivor, myles-munroe, planning, preparation, purpose, relocate, success, talents, thinking, thoughts, tour

quote: Who you are
author: that’s your destiny. What you can do to make it happen
category: that’ your purpose. True leaders know both!

author: Israelmore Ayivor, Leaders' Watchwords

quote: In the path of our happiness shall we find the learning for which we have chosen this lifetime.
author: Richard Bach, Illusions: The Adventures of a Reluctant Messiah

quote: If life's journey was intended to be easy, we would have been given directions. However, since we have no road map, we must climb the highest mountain and forge the deepest streams with love in our souls, in the hope that our own journey will give us peace within...
author: Virginia Alison

quote: ,m./But it is precisely at those moments when the glass seems to be ‘set fair’ that Fate invariably decides to take a hand.
author: John Bude
category: destiny, fairness, fate, set-fair, unpredictability, unpredictability-of-life

quote: Even the dry and dusty arid desert air could not get her sweet perfume out of his nostrils. That one night was all it took. She stole his heart; he could do nothing about it, but accept his fate.
author: Virginia Alison, Heaven Scent

quote: Find the right paths for your journey. Travel along these paths to your final destination.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: destination, destination-quotes, destiny, destiny-and-attitude, faith-quotes, finding, finding-yourself, footprints-in-life, footprints-lessons, inspirational-quotes, journey-of-life, journey-personal-history, journey-quotes, journey-to-yourself, lessons-learned, lessons-learned-in-life, life-and-living, life-philosophy, life-quotes, living-life, motivational-quotes, path-of-life, paths, positive-quotes, purpose-driven-life, spiritual-quotes, travel, travel-quotes, travel-writing, travelers, traveling, traveling-alone, wise-quotes, wise-sayings, wise-words

quote: ...and she would wonder if one can truly stop the inevitable. Was it as Ada had suggested, that we can choose our own endings, joy over sorrow? Or does the cruel world just give and take, give and take, while we flounder through the wilderness?
author: Eowyn Ivey, The Snow Child

quote: Like Artemis and Orion, fate was working against us, and we couldn't be together in this life. But he will forever be immortalized in my heart.
author: A. Zavarelli, Gabriel's Collar

quote: Your opinions about doesn't matter, I know who I am.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: believe-and-achieve, believe-in-yourself, destiny, dreams-and-wishes, drive-desire, opinions-lailah-gifty-akita, opinions-of-people, purpose-of-living, you-can-do-it, yourself

quote: But it is precisely at those moments when the glass seems to be ‘set fair’ that Fate invariably decides to take a hand.
author: John Bude
category: destiny, fairness, fate, set-fair, unpredictability, unpredictability-of-life

quote: It’s too late for you Wilhelmina Grimm, great great great granddaughter of Wilhelm Grimm.
author: Chanda Hahn, UnEnchanted

quote: There's a time when a man needs to fight and a time when he needs to accept that his destiny's lost, the ship has sailed and that only a fool will continue. The truth is I've always been a fool.
author: John August

quote: To say that my existence is entirely inconsequential is to utterly ignore the amazing reality that life is a masterful story penned by a brilliant God who wrote me into the story in such a way that my absence would literally diminish the whole of the story.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
category: calling, destiny, god, life, meaning, purpose, story

quote: When the filly, the maiden, the boy and the warrior are ready to take up their Destinies, each will know it. The filly will become a mare, the maiden a woman, the boy a man. The Warrior, however, will pick up a stick and walk from his mother, his people, and his land, and never once remove his eyes from the true red road that lies beneath his feet. And yet, he will never know that he is on his Path. (From Brothers of Light)
author: Stan Sudan, Sisters of Light

quote: Only fate would decree how it reached its destiny, which always waited just around the corner, over the hill...
author: Virginia Alison

quote: Insanity, thy name is woman
author: Virginia Alison, Heaven Scent

quote: As long as God hasn't counted us out from the realities of our destines, victory will always be ours.
category: destinies, destiny, edmond-mbiaka, god-hasn-t-counted-us-out, our-realities, victory-is-ours

quote: You can no more look destiny in the face than you can look at the sun, and yet destiny is grey
author: Henri Barbusse

quote: Love is waiting, just around the corner, over the hill...
author: Virginia Alison
category: destiny, fate, love, romance-novels, romantic, soul

quote: Success becomes inevitable when you fence your destiny with God's word.
category: becoming-successful, destiny, edmond-mbiaka, god-s-word, inevitable, success

quote: Grace: All that I am and will be.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: believers, believers-in-god, destiny, divine-favour, divine-grace, faith, faith-in-god, faith-quotes, god, journey-quotes, religion-christianity, religious-faith, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spirituality, spirituality-vs-religion

quote: Fate is a given, destiny is what we do with it
author: Shavasti, Embracing the Power of Truth

quote: Destiny was funny stuff, he knew. You couldn’t trust it. Often you couldn’t even see it. Just when you knew you had it cornered, it turned out to be something else—coincidence, maybe, or providence. You barred the door against it, and it was standing behind you. Then just when you thought you had it nailed down it walked away with the hammer.
author: Terry Pratchett, Wyrd Sisters

quote: Destiny is no more than the fulfillment of purposive potentialities within us. The human cerebral cortex is a single sheet composed of more neurons than there are stars in the known universe folded like a paper crane to fit in a quart-sized cubbyhole
author: there is enough potential energy in a single person that if released would equal thirty hydrogen bombs. Destiny is nothing to sneeze at!

quote: Let me here remind you that the essence of dramatic tragedy is not unhappiness. It resides in the solemnity of the remorseless working of things. This inevitableness of destiny can only be illustrated in terms of human life by incidents which in fact involve unhappiness. For it is by them that the futility of escape can be made evident in the drama. This remorseless inevitableness is what pervades scientific thought. The laws of physics are the decrees of fate.
author: Alfred North Whitehead
category: destiny, drama, fate, philosophy, physics, science, tragedy

quote: This was her destiny, and it was a fit and proper one. She was not unwilling, but she knew this was a fateful moment, and she had a sense of doors closing behind her and the path of her life being fixed irrevocably.
author: Ken Follett, The Pillars of the Earth

quote: ...our ability to achieve our dreams and fulfill our destiny is directly influenced by our thinking. How we think determines our responses, our ability to relate to others, our level of commitment, our priorities, and the dreams we will pursue.
author: Christine Caine
category: christine-caine, commitment, destiny, dreams, priorities, thinking

quote: Sometimes our fate – our destiny turns out to be something we had never thought of.
author: Waheed Ibne Musa, Johnny Fracture

quote: God gave us imaginations because he wants us to see the photos of our destinies respectively and make proper graphical designs of them. You owe it to yourself to enlarge that image you carry into bigger sizes.

quote: In business, ruthlessness is righteousness.Seldom are there those, whom are ruthlessly righteous.Listen to these people, before the Earth repents of mankind.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau
category: business, destiny, earth, mankind, prophecy, rare, repentance, righteousness, ruthless, seldom, univers

quote: She shook her head in perplexity. "I'll never know where you got the idea that you were destined for greatness." She dropped the rest of the rabbit in the pot and begun to clean the underside of its skin. She would use the fur. "You certainly didn't inherit it from your forebears.
author: Ken Follett, The Pillars of the Earth

quote: If you don't know who you are, you will never know what belongs to you!
author: Gail Hayes

quote: We appealed to the conscience of the world. The world has no conscience. We have no one but ourselves."The fight. The struggle. The historic destiny. The return of the people. The cause: life therefore having a meaning and shape that eludes the rest of us in the endless wash of 'What the hell are we doing here?' In a single day, says an Israeli friend, he experiences events and emotions that would keep a Swede going for a year.
author: David Hare, Via Dolorosa & When Shall We Live?

quote: You are today where your decisions have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your decisions will take you. If you really want to know who you are now, take a tour about the decisions you made some years back.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: actions, choice, choose, chosen, decide, decisions, destiny, food-for-thought, israelmore-ayivor, today, tomorrow

quote: This is my calling.This is my destiny.I am living my dreams.

category: calling-dreams, destiny, dream-big, dreams-quotes, your-destiny, your-journey, your-life

quote: Every woman is called to lead somebody somewhere to do something great!
author: Gail Hayes

quote: I don’t think I believe in any god,” Merla said. “I think we make our own destiny. I think religion is superstition. Does that shock you?”Agata shook her head and smiled. “If the Goddess is kind, then she will allow you your doubts, and embrace believers and unbelievers alike. If she is not, then the witches are mistaken, and we should not be worshipping her anyway.
author: Duncan Harper, Witch of the Fall

quote: 105If you don't know who you are, you will never know what belongs to you!
author: Gail Hayes

quote: I’ve learned that you cannot fulfill your destiny if you’re not being yourself; you can’t fulfill your destiny, trying to be somebody else. We are created unique not so that we can fit in, but so that we can stand out.
author: Jeanette Coron

quote: Fulfilling our destiny and realizing our potential all begins in our mind. That's why the devil tries to bombard our thinking.
author: Christine Caine

quote: Keep encouraging yourself that you are good enough as a workman of God created for every good work one earth prepared for you before the world begun.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: destiny, encourage-yourself, food-for-thought, god, good, good-work, israelmore-ayivor, keep-the-faith, purpose, workman

quote: Don't name our stupidity, ignorance, stupid rules and lack of skills DESTINY!
author: Maliheh Sadat Razavi

quote: Drive your life with care. Look nowhere else than up to your long cherished destination. You can only get there with focus. Blind your eyes from anything else!

quote: Be the author, not the reader, of your own life.
author: Paul Gibbons, Reboot Your Life: A 12-day Program for Ending Stress, Realizing Your Goals, and Being More Productive

quote: The beauty of traveling solo is that you wonder unexpectedly, but almost certainly into the direction you were meant to go.
author: Shannon Ables

quote: Satan knows, if you are against YOURSELF you will never fulfill your destiny. :(
author: Joel Osteen
category: defeat, destiny, hope, joel-osteen, satan, thoughts

quote: To be in between the two things you love is difficult.Somewhat, destiny comes and helps you choose
author: ranna xxx

quote: Nothing exists without a purpose. Every experience you have in this lifetime was written for you to grow into the light you were meant to be.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: destiny, inspiration, life, light, purpose, quotes, suzy-kassem

quote: The sword of destiny has two edges. You are one of them.
author: Andrzej Sapkowski

quote: An enlightened man had but one duty--to seek the way to himself, to reach inner certainty, to grope his way forward, no matter where it led. The realization shook me profoundly, it was the fruit of this experience. I had often speculated with images of the future, dreamed of roles that I might be assigned, perhaps as poet or prophet or painter, or something similar. 	All that was futile. I did not exist to write poems, to preach or to paint, neither I nor anyone else. All of that was incidental. Each man had only one genuine vocation--to find the way to himself. He might end up as poet or madman, as prophet or criminal--that was not his affair, ultimately it was of no concern. His task was to discover his own destiny--not an arbitrary one--and live it out wholly and resolutely within himself. Everything else was only a would-be existence, an attempt at evasion, aflight back to the ideals of the masses, conformity and fear of one's own inwardness.
author: Hermann Hesse
category: demian, destiny, enlightement, hesse, jobs, men, occupation

quote: Fate was tricky like that. It consumed us when we thought we were free, and it freed us when we thought we were captured.
author: Shannon A. Thompson, Death Before Daylight
category: captured, destined-love, destiny, fate, fated-love, fighting-fate, love, love-quote, stuck, true-love, young-love

quote: The future is certain. It is just not known.
author: Johnny Rich, The Human Script
category: certain, certainty, destiny, determinism, fatalism, fate, future, inevitability, knowable, predeterminism, predictability, probability, uncertainty

quote: Where you hang your feelings is where you hang your focus.
author: Shannon L. Alder
category: attitude, career-choices, course-in-life, destiny, feelings, focus, interests, journey, path

quote: Names are powerful and so is destiny, but a person's will is more powerful than both put together.
author: Liesl Shurtliff

quote: In every moment of choice, you create a new destiny.
author: Kevin Michel, Moving Through Parallel Worlds To Achieve Your Dreams
category: ambition, choice, decision, decision-making, decisions, destiny, goals, journey-quotes, many-worlds, many-worlds-interpretation, path-of-life, purpose, success, winning

quote: They have cast my life like dice, in a game that is not a game. The unusual erupted into my life like a storm; I mean unusual in my actual perception of things. Do not mistake me; I never desired things that are certainly harder to bear, and nobody asked me if I really wanted an extraordinary life. That is not entirely true; I was asked, in the way a child seeing a cake is asked if he really wants to eat it.
author: Florian Armas, Io Deceneus: Journal of a Time Traveler

quote: Maybe destiny isn't something that just happens. Maybe destiny is something you do. Maybe destiny is like a seed and it grows.
author: Liesl Shurtliff, Rump: The True Story of Rumpelstiltskin

quote: God has a plan for everyone he created and none of his creations is meant to be purposeless. Every human being for that matter was brought forth with a specific and unique duty to uptake while he lives on earth.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: creations, creator, destiny, earth, food-for-thought, god, human-being, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, mission, plan, purpose, purposeful, unique

quote: Every event in life — the rejections, the relationships, all the embarrassing things you do will lead you to the person you are destined to be with. You may want to change certain things about your past, but everything has been just another chapter in your book of life. If you don’t believe me, buy a book — any book — and rip out an entire chapter — any chapter — and read it. Now, get a full copy of the same book and read it again. Odds are you’ll find that chapter pieced everything together the way it was supposed to be.
author: Mike Zacchio
category: books, chapters, destiny, fate, life-lessons, life-quotes, purpose, romance, soulmates, true-love

quote: Don’t panic, you are never alone in building up your dreams. The storehouse of your success was built by the very supreme father who created it for you.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: big-dreams, destiny, dream-big, dreams, fear, food-for-thought, frighten, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, loneliness, lonely, panic, purpose, storehouse, success, supreme

quote: If you don’t figure out your main reason of being born, chances are that, you will fall into another plan which is unlikely to make you to print out your bigger picture!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: action, destiny, dream-big, failure, food-for-thought, israelmore-ayivor, plan, purpose, purpose-of-life, self-discovery, success

quote: The art of statemanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord

The realization shook me profoundly, it was the fruit of this experience. I had often speculated with images of the future, dreamed of roles that I might be assigned, perhaps as poet orprophet or painter, or something similar. 	All that was futile. I did not exist to write poems, to preach or topaint, neither I nor anyone else. All of that was incidental. Each man had only one genuine vocation--to findthe way to himself. quote: From the very beginning, there was not the slightest doubt that Olga da Polga was the sort of guinea pig who would go places.
author: Michael Bond, The Tales of Olga Da Polga

quote: If you will trust your destiny it will be your religion.
author: Auliq Ice

quote: How do you know it is destiny? Because it is!
author: William R. Morris

quote: Fate can not be proven or disproven so act knowing that destiny is a product of your every thought and every action.

quote: Experiences might teach us to be cautious, but never to be paranoid. Paranoia is a limiter of destiny
author: Mr Imbuya

quote: We're born with a mapped-out route. This one, not that one. Who you dream with. Who you love. It's one or the other. You choose without choosing. That's how it is. Each of us travels on their own path. Besides, how do you love someone without truly knowing who they are? How do you travel that distance when there's all that you don't know about the other?
author: Susana Fortes, Waiting for Robert Capa

quote: Romance this moment, this hour, this day. String moments together like pearls on a rope.
author: Rachelle Du Bois

quote: How can I possibly stop loving you when it's sort of predestined? — Malcom Lowry to Carol Brown, 1926 (age 16)
author: David Eso

quote: Every man walks his own path, and every path has its fair share of locked doors. You never know who holds the key to a door you’ll need to open one day, so you best treat people as if they are all keyholders.
